sentences.text: In 1995, Second Amendment scholarship had been almost entirely nonexistent for decades, and what little there was (mostly written by lobbyists for gun-control groups) treated the matter as open-and-shut: The Second Amendment , we were told, protected only the right of state militias (or as former Chief Justice Warren Burger characterized them, " state armies ") to possess guns.

sentences.ctext: In 1995, Second Amendment scholarship had been almost entirely nonexistent for decades, and what little there was (mostly written by lobbyists for gun-control groups) treated the matter as open-and-shut: The Second Amendment , we were told, protected only the right of state militias (or as former Chief Justice Warren Burger characterized them, " state armies ") to possess guns.

sentences.text: Lower court opinions, to the extent they existed, were largely in agreement, and the political discussion, such as it was, generally held that anyone who believed that the Second Amendment might embody a judicially enforceable right for ordinary citizens to possess guns was a shill probably paid for the NRA.

sentences.ctext: Lower court opinions, to the extent they existed, were largely in agreement, and the political discussion, such as it was, generally held that anyone who believed that the Second Amendment might embody a judicially enforceable right for ordinary citizens to possess guns was a shill probably paid for the NRA.

sentences.text: Whatever the Second Amendment meant, it did not, we were told, protect a right of individuals to possess firearms, enforceable in court against governmental entities that infringed on individuals' gun possession.

sentences.text: But then came a wave of scholarship, much of it by eminent constitutional scholars ranging from William Van Alstyne , to Laurence Tribe , to Sanford Levinson , to Robert Cottrol , exploring the original purposes and understanding of the Second Amendment.

sentences.ctext: But then came a wave of scholarship, much of it by eminent constitutional scholars ranging from William Van Alstyne , to Laurence Tribe , to Sanford Levinson , to Robert Cottrol , exploring the original purposes and understanding of the Second Amendment.

sentences.text: By the turn of the millennium, it was well-established among scholars that the Second Amendment was intended to protect an individual right to arms, one that would be enforceable in court against infringements by states, municipalities and the federal government.
sentences.mtext: By=by=IN=0 the=the=DT=1 turn=turn=NN=2 of=of=IN=3 the=the=DT=4 millennium=millennium=NN=5 ,=,=,=6 it=it=PP=7 was=be=VBD=8 well-established=well-established=JJ=9 among=among=IN=10 scholars=scholar=NNS=11 that=that=IN=12 the=the=DT=13 Second=Second=NP=14 Amendment=Amendment=NP=15 was=be=VBD=16 intended=intend=VBN=17 to=to=TO=18 protect=protect=VB=19 an=an=DT=20 individual=individual=JJ=21 right=right=NN=22 to=to=TO=23 arms=arm=NNS=24 ,=,=,=25 one=one=CD=26 that=that=WDT=27 would=would=MD=28 be=be=VB=29 enforceable=enforceable=JJ=30 in=in=IN=31 court=court=NN=32 against=against=IN=33 infringements=infringement=NNS=34 by=by=IN=35 states=state=NNS=36 ,=,=,=37 municipalities=municipality=NNS=38 and=and=CC=39 the=the=DT=40 federal=federal=JJ=41 government=government=NN=42 .=.=SENT=43
sentences.ctext: By the turn of the millennium, it was well-established among scholars that the Second Amendment was intended to protect an individual right to arms, one that would be enforceable in court against infringements by states, municipalities and the federal government.

sentences.text: And, with the decisions in District of Columbia v. Heller and McDonald v. Chicago , the U.S. Supreme Court agreed.
sentences.mtext: And=and=CC=0 ,=,=,=1 with=with=IN=2 the=the=DT=3 decisions=decision=NNS=4 in=in=IN=5 District=District=NP=6 of=of=IN=7 Columbia=Columbia=NP=8 v.=v.=CC=9 Heller=Heller=NP=10 and=and=CC=11 McDonald=McDonald=NP=12 v.=v.=CC=13 Chicago=Chicago=NP=14 ,=,=,=15 the=the=DT=16 U.S.=U.S.=NP=17 Supreme=Supreme=NP=18 Court=Court=NP=19 agreed=agree=VBD=20 .=.=SENT=21
sentences.ctext: And, with the decisions in District of Columbia v. Heller and McDonald v. Chicago , the U.S. Supreme Court agreed.

sentences.text: The Heller decision struck down the District of Columbia's draconian gun-control law, while McDonald made clear that the Second Amendment protected not only against federal incursions into gun rights (the District of Columbia is a federal enclave) but also to infringements involving states and municipalities.
sentences.mtext: The=the=DT=0 Heller=Heller=NP=1 decision=decision=NN=2 struck=strike=VBD=3 down=down=RP=4 the=the=DT=5 District=District=NP=6 of=of=IN=7 Columbia=Columbia=NP=8 's='s=POS=9 draconian=draconian=JJ=10 gun-control=gun-control=NN=11 law=law=NN=12 ,=,=,=13 while=while=IN=14 McDonald=McDonald=NP=15 made=make=VBD=16 clear=clear=JJ=17 that=that=IN=18 the=the=DT=19 Second=Second=NP=20 Amendment=Amendment=NP=21 protected=protect=VBD=22 not=not=RB=23 only=only=RB=24 against=against=IN=25 federal=federal=JJ=26 incursions=incursion=NNS=27 into=into=IN=28 gun=gun=NN=29 rights=right=NNS=30 (=(=(=31 the=the=DT=32 District=District=NP=33 of=of=IN=34 Columbia=Columbia=NP=35 is=be=VBZ=36 a=a=DT=37 federal=federal=JJ=38 enclave=enclave=NN=39 )=)=)=40 but=but=CC=41 also=also=RB=42 to=to=TO=43 infringements=infringement=NNS=44 involving=involve=VBG=45 states=state=NNS=46 and=and=CC=47 municipalities=municipality=NNS=48 .=.=SENT=49
sentences.ctext: The Heller decision struck down the District of Columbia's draconian gun-control law, while McDonald made clear that the Second Amendment protected not only against federal incursions into gun rights (the District of Columbia is a federal enclave) but also to infringements involving states and municipalities.

sentences.text: Subsequent lower court cases, like Moore v. Madigan and Peruta v. San Diego , have held that the Second Amendment supports not only a right to keep a gun in one's home for self-protection, but also a right to carry a gun in public for self-defense.

sentences.ctext: Since they see guns as the primary mechanism that facilitates self-defense, they would discourage self-defense by banning guns.

sentences.text: An outgrowth of this point of view is the law that HCI and CSGV succeeded in having adopted by the District of Columbia in 1976: Householders may not buy handguns, nor may guns of any type be kept assembled or loaded for self-defense.16 It was under these laws that the District achieved its dubious honor of being known as the "murder capital" of America, yet HCI continually urges cities and states to pass this same law, trumpeting again and again that "the only reason for guns in civilian hands is for sporting purposes."

sentences.text: In a free society, the only legitimate basis for law is controlling dangerous behavior, not imposing a minority moral vision on the majority.

sentences.text: Public weighs in against gun control Blake Seitz RedAndBlack.com | 1comment I planned this column in advance, expecting to be drawn into a vicious, dukes-up brawl about gun control upon my return to the paper.

sentences.text: For a week or two following the horror in Newtown, Conn., where 27 people, including 20 young children, were murdered by a firearm-wielding madman, the gun debate was everywhere you went: I had a civil back-and-forth with my dentist (never agitate a man with dental forceps) about the effectiveness of the Federal Assault Weapons Ban.
